title: Broken PR
body: My force push seems to have messed up the PR. Sorry, remaking

title: Allow getting a repository by ID
body:
Other clients use the undocumented api to get a repository by ID. Can we add that to this client as well?

Examples:
PHP: https://github.com/KnpLabs/php-github-api/pull/579
Python: https://github.com/PyGithub/PyGithub/blob/b64b0d6942bb27095bd035b8c0db10ca35448be3/github/MainClass.py#L191
OctoKit supports it: https://github.com/octokit/rest.js/issues/163#issuecomment-450007728

And it seems to be sticking around indefinitely: https://github.com/piotrmurach/github/issues/283#issuecomment-249092851

title: Methods to update milestones
body: Currently you can only close and reopen them, but it would be nice to also be able to edit the other properties like title, description and due date.

title: Added getUserPublicOrganizations method
body:
It may be the case (especially with GitHub Enterprise installations) that a single authenticated user wants to find out about Organization membership for users other than themselves.

This adds a `getUserPublicOrganizations(GHUser user)` method to enable that lookup.

I wasn't able to complete the test-suite locally due to permission issues that sounded similar to [this mailing-list post from August 2018](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/github-api/cCKoKlcq-ng/tbZLW3VfAwAJ).

title: Fixed typo of ADMIN_HOOK variable
body: Fixed the variable typo and also sending a PR to Github Plugin which uses this variable.

title: Update maven dependency
body: Update of Maven dependency versions

title: OkHttp3Connector uses a deprecated and now removed API in Okhttp 3.14.0
body: According to https://github.com/square/okhttp/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#version-3140. `OkUrlFactory` was removed from okhttp 3.14.0, making the upgrade impossible when your application requires okhttp as the default mechanism for HTTP requests.

title: Add ETAG support to minimize API requests
body:
If we use `ETAG`s to make [conditional requests](https://developer.github.com/v3/#conditional-requests) then the `304 Not Modified` responses do not count against our API limit.

This could make our API requests faster and use up less of our API limit.

title: Ability to commit textContent directly to tree, without intermediate blobs
Added equals and hashcode
body: I added the required methods from the following issue: https://github.com/kohsuke/github-api/issues/501

title: Create PR from original repo to private org fork
body:
Use case: when fork is done into private organization then the original repo maintainer can't have any access there hence this field has to be set to `false` explicitly.

Added parameter: `maintainerCanModify` to `GHRepository.createPullRequest` method. 

- Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request

Original method is kept for backward compatibility defaulting the parameter to `true`.

title: Add GHPullRequestReview.submitted_at field
body: This is a fix for https://github.com/kohsuke/github-api/issues/450

title: Update GHissue.label accordingly when labels change
body:
Update Findbugs Plugin to 3.0.5 to be compatible with Maven 3.6.0

This addresses #495.

title: GitHub.connectUsingOAuth() suddenly taking a really long time to connect
body: Hi I've been creating a program using GitHub.connectUsingOAuth(), however, suddenly it decided to take a really long time to connect to GitHub, (well over 30seconds), however, when I use connect anonymously it will connect instantly, is this a known issue / some random hiccup?

title: fixed membership role problem with case
body: Fix for problem described in issue #491

title: GHTeam.add fails
body: GHTeam.add fails due to use of incorrect roles case when calling github. Problem is caused by using .with("role", role.name()) instead of .with("role", role)

title: proposed fix for GHTeam.add in issue #489
body: This breaks library reverse compatibility for code that uses original GHTeam.Role.MEMBER and GHTeam.Role.MAINTAINER. Alternative is worse since reverse compatibility can only be preserved at expense of valueOf and using toString instead of name

title: GHTeam.add does not due to GHTeam.Role(s) been capitalized
body: When trying to add a MAINTAINER or MEMBER to the team in GHE 2.16.1 org.kohsuke.github.HttpException: {"message":"Invalid request.\n\nMEMBER is not a member of [\"member\", \"maintainer\"].","documentation_url":"https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/teams/members/#add-or-update-team-membership"} is thrown. It appears to be capitalization problem.

title: create an organization and team
body:
- Create an organization
- Create a team and assign maintainers without repositories

title: Reading file's content through GHContent.read() returns previous version of file.
remove system.out from listOrgs
body: Removal of a `System.out` usage printing the pageSize on each iteration.

title: Add support for editing Gists
body:
Fixes issue #466.

Added the following methods:

- GHGist.setDescription
- GHGist.addFile
- GHGist.updateFile
 - GHGist.renameFile

NOTE: I could not get the deleteFile() method to work. I have left it commented-out.

title: Add support for projects
body:
Fixes issue #425.

Added methods:

- GitHub.getProject(int id)
- GHRepository.createProject()
- GHRepository.listProjects()
- GHOrganization.createProject()
- GHOrganization.listProjects()

Added the GHProject class.

title: Add method to invite user to organization
body:
Fixes issue #467.

Added method `GHOrganization.add(GHUser user, Role role)`.

title: Added method to list authorizations
body:
Fixes issue #459.

Added method `GitHub.listMyAuthorizations()`.

title: Escape special characters in branch URLs
body: Fix for issue #381.

title: Add issue events API
body:
Fix for issue #376 (add issue events API).

Added the following methods:

 - GHIssue.listEvents()
 - GHRepository.listIssueEvents()
 - GHRepository.getIssueEvent(int id)

title: Added description field to GHTeam class.
body: Fixes issue #460.
